items.title: Another terrible experience 60 quid…
items.review_text: Another terrible experience 60 quid down the drain more delays catching buses instead of trains its all over the place lines broken its one failure after another they are a complete joke I am not going to use them anymore enough is enough and public do not use them ....

items.title: PATHETIC COMPANY
items.review_text: They are always delayed or have cancellations. Not once a week but every day.  Their customer service is pathetic. Good luck trying to get a refund when a train has been cancelled its almost impossible. They ask for things that you can't give them. DISGRACE OF A COMPANY, should be investigated by trading standards.

items.title: Train No bigger than a Bus
items.review_text:
Why is it that the TFW company only ever put on 2 coaches at peak hours for journeys between Cardiff and Merthyr Tydfil.

Numerous times the 2 carriages are rammed full of commuters who have to stand for extremely long periods.

Then they have to try their best to balance as the train stops or pulls off.

Surely they have a spare carriage somewhere

This must be a H&S issue

items.title: Missed eye test appointments
items.review_text:
We had booked eye test appointments in Shrewsbury for Sunday 7th April 2024.

On leaving the house from Newtown Powys, we were pleased to see that after checking on-line, the train was expecting on time. Indeed the information board at the station confirmed that on arriving at the station.

The expected train never turned up and we missed our important eye test appointments. Some 20 other passengers were also left bewildered too, some with young children.

Apparently, the train arrived 90 minutes later than scheduled. 

TFW are a disgrace with services constantly running late, all too often with bus replacements, misleading information and trains running with only two coaches causing ridiculous overcrowding.

I dread having to travel by TFW and only do so if all other transport avenues are closed.

The Board of TFW Wales should be sacked, as looking at the number of negative reviews they receive on this site are diabolical. 

As I write this my Son has just messaged me to his train is severely delayed and will not get home nearly two hours later than the scheduled service!!

UNBELIEVABLE.

items.title: Transport for Wales is giving wales a…
items.review_text: Transport for Wales is giving wales a bad name. they are ruining peoples changes of employment opportunities and health care. one star is too much

items.title: Trains cancelled again
items.review_text: Trains cancelled again for brand new trains needed repair, next train half the carriages, double the people. As ever an unreliable, uncomfortable service provided.

items.title: 1 star is too many
items.review_text: 1 star is too many.  Waited for 9:54 train today.  Told on board and app it was 10 mins late.  Announcement made to stand clear of platform edge.  No train came.  Repeat for 10:54.  11:54 I got hold of TFW on WhatsApp who confirmed train was running and updated me on it going from station to station sometimes even leaving late, right up till it left the station before ours and they said actully never left the first station but 12:54 would come.  That was too late for cinema so went into cinema app and hit refund.  It just worked.  No option in train app for train ticket refund.  On website it gave number.  The person on there saw that trains had run on his system so sent me to customer care who saw it had not run but said could not refund and I must refund them again.  Else could talk to escalations who do not work Sundays.  They said would put note on file.  Redialed refunds who said no note on file but can see train did not run and will refund.  Let’s see if money comes back or not?

items.title: Complete shamble-no care for mid-wales…
items.review_text: Buses replace trains on a regular basis at Aberystwyth -with no information at the station as its not the ticketoffice staffs job unless asked?  Departure board show train cancelled with no info about replacement bus sitting away from the station.Complete lack of any customer and response from customercare about complaints are dismissive or blame others for what is TfWshortcomings.As several members of staff have said "bring back Arriva".

items.title: Train delayed,  platform changed, unhelpful staff…
items.review_text: Train from Chester to Crewe changed platform several times without warning. Was delayed by about 20 minutes, again no warning and no reliable source of information available. No staff in sight except for one member of staff with very poor, unsympathetic and abrupt attitude. Some would call it rude.  Missed connection as a result, stuck at Crewe for an hour waiting for next connection and delayed by at least as long. Abysmal service

items.title: Cancelled train and ruined birthday
items.review_text: Cancelled train and ruined birthday. Booked a group ticket for a trip for my mother’s 80th birthday. Train was cancelled the day before due to staff shortages and I found out by accident. Only got a refund for the ticket weeks later after dealing with extremely unhelpful staff and was charged an admin fee for this. Received no apology for ruining our trip, just ignored completely. Will definitely not book with TFW again.

items.title: Unhelpful staff at railway station
items.review_text: Unhelpful staff at Cardiff Railway Station - needed to amend tickets for identical trip on different dates (should be free to do this). They charged £10 for each ticket, without pre-warning when amending, and shrugged when I said it would be free to do so online. Did not explain anything, and unfriendly.

items.title: Why do I get junk emails from trasport…
items.review_text:
Why do I get junk emails from trasport wales  yet the option to unsubsrice is the smalles hiden option on the page , and why do transport wales feel its ok to email me but have no emeil address to contact them.
What sort of organisation are they running.
 We all know really.  scams operate similar ,they are pathetic in my view.

items.title: Ticket guy being aggressive and rude
items.review_text: Ticket guy was very disrespectful. Told me to ‘f off’ after asking how is the tickets more expensive when paying on the train than on the app. Around £3.20 on app and £5.90 on the train? Dont see how there’s a £2 difference. He was very aggressive and slammed my receipt down in an aggressive manner.

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give zero stars I would! And where to start with a review for this company - they are an absolute shower of doodoo! 

Every time I’ve booked a ticket, the train has been cancelled - every single time! 

The first time I travelled with them, I got a train to my destination, but then, on the way home, they told us the train was no longer going to our destination stop, so we all had to get out and TFW left us stranded at a train station and weren’t even going to put a replacement coach on for us because they said no coaches would be running at 9pm, but they didn’t seem to care a jot how we were to get home and this was after our train had been delayed at the original departure station for nearly 2 hours!

If you do actually manage to get a train, there is never a refreshment trolley anymore and apparently this is because they can’t get any staff. Well if they run their business in such an appalling manner, is it any wonder they can’t get staff?

This company is a nationalised one - it’s not private - and unfortunately, it’s a perfect advertisement for privatisation, which is a real shame, but it’s pointless selling tickets for train services that never run and then having to refund them.

But it does no good to complain, because no one is listening. TFW couldn’t care less whether you can’t get to work, if you miss an appointment or end up stranded at 9pm in a station with no way home.

TFW do little more than constantly disappoint. They’re completely unreliable, so unfortunately, you end up having to go by car - which completely defeats the object - I want to use public transport for several reasons - not least environmental ones - but that’s impossible when there’s no public transport available to use, on the day.

Sack the lot of them and bring back Arriva Trains Wales - because something really needs to be done about this utter shower of …….

items.title: Trains For Wales Deserve A Big ZERO
items.review_text:
Trains For Wales Deserve A Big ZERO
I caught a train from Manchester Piccalilli Station to Port Talbot. It is a Diabolic Service Food Trolley No buffet . If You Catch Train From Chester They Get Everything Decent Carriages .Hot Food From Buffet Bar . Manchester Is Main Station With Routes To Many City And Other Trains Running Out From There Surply A Better Service TFW Need To Surply Better Clean Warm Carriage And More Seats As The Train Is Normally 2 Carriage Loco And I've Stood For Most Of My Journey With A Disability And Over Priced Fare IT A Disgusting Service

items.title: Hurray for Jim a dying breed and a proper gentleman.
items.review_text: Cannot recommend Jim at Haverfordwest railway station enough. We had an ongoing issue concerning delay repay, and i was getting nowhere online only a lot of stress. We went to see Jim where we bought the tickets in the first place and he resolved it straight away.Please do not buy your tickets online you will get a much better deal with Jim, he is worth his weight in gold, long may he remain there.

items.title: The train from Cardiff to Manchester is…
items.review_text:
The train from Cardiff to Manchester is an absolute disgrace.
I travel regularly by train in the uk and worldwide and although many UK trains are of very poor standard compared to the rest of Europe, the aforementioned line is appalling.Regularly breaking down, Extremely uncomfortable seating.Heating that rarely works, Today there was no working toilet and very rarely is there any refreshment service so there’s not even water available on a 3 hour 45 minute journey. Trains in many third world countries are a lot better than this! I absolutely despair!

items.title: Get rid of Transport for Wales
items.review_text: Worthless, useless service to Pembrokeshire. Frequently 50% of trains cancelled and they've stopped even bothering to give a reason. Oh, but they're replacing perfectly ok rain shelters at doubtless vast cost. I even saw 2-3 workmen painting a station fence sparkling white. Something to stare at while you despair?!

items.title: Thank you
items.review_text:
I have just had a totally stress free refund on my tickets by TFW. The lovely Lorraine was efficient ,empathic and human.

Well done after dealing with the inapptitude of other rail companies TFW was a refreshing change. 

I shall now rebook my journey with TFW as they have earnt my custom with excellent customer service.  Thank you

items.title: Bad doesn’t really say it all
items.review_text: Bad doesn’t really say it all. Late. Cancelled. Reluctant to follow their own rules for cancellation refunds. Typical welsh government owned company. Rubbish. Why wouldn’t I drive instead?

items.title: TFW is an embarrassment
items.review_text: This company is the worst train company I have ever come across. Barely any trains re on time, they get cancelled with no warming/reason/refund. Some ticket men are really rude and obviously hate their jobs. Industrial action isn’t handled well and most valley lines don’t run after a certain time/at all. I’m embarrassed that this is wales’ attempt at a train company and also the fact that I ya r to rely on this as my main mode of transport means I have been late numerous times due to trains and I have had to find alternate ways home multiple times as well. Needs insane improvements but nothing seems to be being done. At lease they’re refurbishing central station that didn’t really need doing in the first place!

items.title: A disgusting train
items.review_text:
Caught the 7:45 from Cardiff to Milford Haven on 17th January 2024.
The floor is filthy, it clearly hadn’t been swept or washed in months, piles of leaves, mud and debris scatter the floor.
The table has cut marks and the covering has been scratched off in many places, right down to the structure.
Some seats have damage and all show signs of wear.
Being January, there is no heat whatsoever and  people are shivering.
This has been an awful journey, cold and miserable.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service from train for wales from carmarthen to Cardiff also includes return trips . In the last month of traveling on about route.arrived at station noted our train was cancelled waited and 1hour then that train was cancelled as well. Reason this time was lack of drivers .return strips was something the same or another reason.also told us to leave the train on platform 4 due to engine fault and cross over to platform 2 to go on another train to Swansea and swoop train there to Carmarthen.due to be pensioners found carrying heavy suitcases over to platform 2 with difficulty and stressful. Next trip to Cardiff will be coming soon will have to thing other ways to travel..

items.title: Non stop loud public announcements on…
items.review_text:
Non stop loud public announcements on tfw trains
Why is tfr obsessed with dozens of loud disruptive announcements on its trains 
Numerous passengers shaking their heads at the constant announcements 
Do tfw not understand passengers just want a quiet peaceful journey

items.title: Appalling and shameful
items.review_text: People standing up all the way from Cardiff to Manchester, no refreshments on a five-hour journey (this stopped a few years ago), only two carriages (and more like a bus than a train), no leg-room, no luggage space for bigger bags, only overhead storage (difficult for older people), extortionate prices (£100 single). Where does the money (and gov funding) go? CEO Jonathan Price, on £160,000 a year.

items.title: Couldn't run a bath never mind a…
items.review_text:
Couldn't run a bath never mind a railway.

If a train shows up and not one of their rail replacements buses then they are always late, short formed - particularly at weekends when longer trains are needed, they are filthy with litter and the staff are often rude. By far the worst train operating company in Britain. They make travelling in Wales miserable.

Another monopoly that gets it so wrong. And looking on the website they have a whole conference room full of highly paid executives and not one of them has the slightest clue how bad this company is. Shameful.

items.title: Another terrible journey
items.review_text: Another terrible journey, 12.29 from jct to Crewe. Only 2 carriages, aisles crammed, doorways full and impossible to get off train. Always the same

items.title: I missed my connection to Newport but thank goodness for Ceri!
items.review_text: I missed my connection to Newport on Friday 28th April 2023. It was getting late, I was very tired already from travelling and anxious that I needed to be in Bangor for a certain time. A customer ambassador called Ceri was absolutely brilliant! I can’t thank him enough. He very quickly made me feel calm and supported me to find another connection which meant I could continue my journey in good time. What a lovely, lovely, supportive, kind and friendly  man. We even had a good chat. Thank you so much Ceri you helped me enormously and I can’t thank you enough. What a fabulous service!

items.title: Gross pay for CEO
items.review_text:
How can TfW possibly justify paying James Price: Chief Executive Officer of TfW £160,000 last year when he quite clearly isn't capable of organising a knees up in a brewery.
An absolute disgrace when commuters suffer on a daily basis.
Hang your head in shame and hand your gross salary back James.

items.title: How is this TfW not being sued on a…
items.review_text:
How is this company not being sued on a regular basis? Every penny is undeserved, just the same as all other reviews, filthy and ridiculously overcrowded. Standing all the way from Newport to Manchester, even old and disabled people. Must be totally new to TfW that 2 coaches don't suffice. How is nobody interfering on this? 
@Trustpilot: Time to introduce 0 stars or less, even that would be way too flattering for this

items.title: We just met a very helpful and friendly…
items.review_text: We just met a very helpful and friendly member of staff at Hereford Train Station.. My wife and I were using our senior railcards for the first time .. Imogen went above and beyond helping us with tech issues.. she was so patient .. she's a wonderful ambassador for TFW.. give her a massive wage rise.. she deserves it

items.title: Absolute joke of a service.
items.review_text:
Absolute joke of a service.
Missed at least 3 job interviews and lost a job thanks to that bunch of clueless incompetents.

Never informed when train line is down, bus replacement never turn up.

I do not Blame the drivers as the poor ones usually don t know more than the public, but God knows the incompetens ones up in the office need to stop touching themselves and start to work because this is far beyond pathetic.

items.title: Travelled to Manchester from Leominster…
items.review_text: Travelled to Manchester from Leominster on Sat 12th November. 3 carriages, but still full. Train taken out of service at Crewe due to "bird Strike". Replacement train only 2 carriages. Not enough room to accommodate all passengers. Return even worse. The 16.31 cancelled, 17.31 cancelled, 18.31 cancelled. Why? the only explanation given was due to severe overcrowding in Cardiff due to rugby international.  No one at Manchester could tell passengers what was going on or when we could expect the next train. absolute shambles and the Welsh gover4nment should be ashamed of THEIR train service. Bring back Arriva.

items.title: A joke
items.review_text: A joke. Tfw are a byword for incompetence and poor service. Trains are late, too few carriages, Wi-Fi doesn’t work, phone chargers don’t work the list of deficiencies is endless and getting worse since the Welsh government took them over.

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text: Travelled today from Newport to Shrewsbury on the Milford Haven to Manchester Piccadilly train. Only two coaches and peaple having to stand.  Covid has not gone and there was no chance to remain 2 metres from anyone. They need to increase rolling stock and add extra coaches on busy routes. The journey was  just under two hours duration but at no time did the guard show his face to check tickets or check that passengers were OK.

items.title: Can anyone in this Company even do basic maths?
items.review_text: And STILL, after decades, this joke of a company feels that  2 carriages on a peak time train is sufficient.  Why has nobody done a public study of just how many passengers are squeezed on to their filthy trains, how many fail to even get on, and why on Earth the experience is so eye-watering expensive.

items.title: I am currently on the 0850 train from…
items.review_text:
I am currently on the 0850 train from Cardiff to Manchester Picadilly.

I cannot believe the amount of people that are being made to stand because of a lack of seats. Yet these paying customers have in the main paid the same as other passengers.

Apart from the severe discomfort, Total lack of refreshments, WiFi that doesn't work, what I am most concerned about is the health and safety aspect of people being stood on a fast moving form of transport. 

Get your act together TfW

items.title: Poor Attitude
items.review_text: Pay rise? To hell with that. Being paid too much money to do too little. The Queen Street Station staff especially. Paid for standing doing nothing. The public toilets are disgraceful. As for TFW staff in general, they need to learn good manners!!

items.title: Train cancelled again from Chester to…
items.review_text:
Train cancelled again from Chester to Wrexham. Signalling fault.

It's so predictable that it's time to take the bus or drive. I keep buying return tickets and never get the chance to use tbe return ticket.

Arriva are making a good profit thanks to TFWs incompetence.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Ticket collectors are often rude and I’ve found they can be patronising at times when I have asked for clarity on when I can use my rail card. Trains are also constantly late or cancelled meaning I am always late for events. Would not recommend this service.

items.title: Inadequate & unreliable
items.review_text:
Inadequate, lousy & expensive. You stand a 50/50 chance of being stranded; unreliable joke of a service! 
I am disabled. Waited for a 256 at the jubilee by pass, pulled in for a second, didn't open the doors, then the woman driver just pulled off leaving me and several other passengers stranded. UNRELIABLE SO CALLED SERVICE!

items.title: I have given up on TFW as the majority…
items.review_text: I have given up on TFW as the majority of the trains are cancelled or delayed. their customer service are equally useless as their train service and the constant platforms changes are equally useless. get rid of TFW.

items.title: Not Even Standing Room!!
items.review_text: Had to stand all the way from Carmarthen to Newport with a 6 year old child, 2 hours plus. Ticket was nearly £200. Never been on a train with these clowns with more than 3 carriages! One of the worst companies I've ever experienced, absolutely no customer service or help offered.

items.title: Inadequate service provider.
items.review_text: Travelled to Crewe from Swansea on Friday 24th September at 10.52am , standing room only for most of the journey on a train consisting of 2 coaches, grossly inadequate. The return journey on 4th October was just as bad, 2 coaches and inadequate space for luggage. Arriva Trains were never as poor as this. Will not travel by TfW ever again,

items.title: I'd also give zero stars if possible
items.review_text: I'd also give zero stars if possible. I commute to work Shrewsbury to Hereford (Manchester to Cardiff line), and honestly, it's impossible. People can lose their job for being late every day, but this company don't care. Feel they are laughing at customers, really. For the last two days, my train to work has been 40 mins late, and the one home cancelled (with an hour to wait until the next one). Hilariously, the tannoy announced a completely different excuse each day. Yesterday was a signal failure at Crewe. Today was 'a fault with this train'. Tomorrow will likely be a repeat of the misery. What excuse will be given? "We are SORRY, but the train has been  abducted by an alien. Transport for Wales apologises for any inconvenience." Totally cheesed off and exhausted.

items.title: Would have walked the journey faster…
items.review_text: It seems like every other day there is a problem on the Merthyr to Cardiff line.  Where is Labour Welsh Government?  My son works a stressful job and today it took nearly FIVE hours for him to get home after they kept cancelling trains.  He would have walked it faster. Public transport is better in any other country I've travelled within. Wales is a joke.

items.title: TFW Trauma Frustration Woe
items.review_text: Nothing will spark TFW into action! Their customer services is pitiful and the CEO shows no interest in responding to letters! Shocking! I am representing a non profit children's literacy and well-being good cause and TFW has caused us a substantial amount of grief - and their bullying tactics seem intent on disregarding their promises of a gesture of good will that is seemingly never to be forthcoming.

items.title: You may get to work, you may then get home...or you may not!
items.review_text:
Crosskeys to Ebbw Vales service and back. 3 out of 5 days the service has been cancelled, this is due to running late! If not cancelling the service, the train either breaks down or they drop you off half way to then either wait for another train (far from home), or they lie to you saying they have alternative transport put on! 
Shambles of a service!

items.title: What a shambolic firm tfw are
items.review_text: What a shambolic firm tfw are. The amount of times I've been late for work over the last few months is unbelievable. Either the train is late or cancelled all together with absolutely no proir warning as happened today. The journey check app said the 6.55 Valley lines from Cardiff to Aberdare was on time. 20 minutes later they said it had been cancelled completely. What an utter disgrace.

items.title: Transport for Wales worst train company in UK
items.review_text: Transport for Wales must be one of the worse train companies in the UK. So many trains cancelled and when they do run they only consist of a couple of carriages so everyone is packed on like sardines. Even worse than Arriva Trains Wales, and that's saying something.  It seems that customers in North Wales and the West Midlands are doomed to have substantard train companies serving our area.

items.title: Cadoxton to Cardiff journey 2 carriages…
items.review_text: Cadoxton to Cardiff journey 2 carriages 7.30am, packed in like third world lepers, conductor called Mike was abusive to an elderly passenger and threatened to throw deck him with a rolled up newspaper, customer service was terrible, the elderly fella has a patch eye and a wooden leg as well dreadful

items.title: Credit where credit is due I had a…
items.review_text:
Credit where credit is due I had a terrible experience with tfw on the 14-10-23 
10.30 from Manchester to Newport booked 1st class due to having medical issues no 1st class and was placed like animals I could not cope and got off the train and took northern trains however on the return journey 1st class was amazing lovely staff and fantastic service a lovely stress free journey so please TFW if you sell 1st class tickets then please provide this service every one has different reasons for travelling 1st class cost comfort and health reasons but hats off you did deliver 1st class service and credit to your staff

items.title: Once again a complete an utter…
items.review_text: Once again a complete an utter shambles. Absolutely useless organisation. Trains are always late and/or cancelled and always overcrowded. They’ve had years now to sort this out and nothing is changing.

items.title: Let's stand all the way to Manchester
items.review_text: Let's stand all the way to Manchester! £100 plus to be rammed in like sardines, standing for hours in a non air conditioned train. Children and OAPs standing all the way. Train already full at Cardiff Central! People face to face coughing and spluttering. Anyone for covid? Don't think of putting on additional carriages TFW?

items.title: Overcharged a group of five
items.review_text:
Overcharged a group of five, for six tickets, and also to Cardiff Bay when there was no service beyond Cardiff Central....
Not enough carraiges - lots of passengers standing. 
Absolutely crap service.

items.title: This is my honest review,
items.review_text:
This is my honest review,
some trains are nice most horrible they tend to stink of stale Pi$$ he masks enforcement officers don't do their job you can go for free most of the time no ticket-checkers there always late and I presume the train had a puncture because there always late the 70% of their staff look like bailiffs and assume everyone's bad

items.title: Wholly Incompetent
items.review_text: They strive to inconvenience your life as much as possible. Oh we're aware of a delay, but we won't update the schedule until last second when you've already travelled to the station. Oh and then we'll push it back 20 minutes. Oh and just before that we'll push it back another 20 minutes. Oh and then we'll just cancel it. Guess I'll just be the hour late for work then? I cannot express how incompetent TFW are. They surpass themselves daily. Yet they get away with it with no accountability every time. Please do the people of the Welsh borders a favour and cease operations. I haven't a good word to say about my experience with this company. I'd have more faith in Philip Schofield looking after my kid than this outfit adhering to a schedule.

items.title: App and machines to pay are useless
items.review_text: Why have app to pay for tickets when it’s down all the time. I will be getting on a train without a ticket because of these lazy scumbags won’t let us buy a ticket on the train with cash since there machines like the app is always down.

items.title: Absolute dog sh**
items.review_text: Absolute dog sh**. Cancelled trains like there’s literally no tomorrow. No replacements. No apologies. No refund. Trains that smell like your cat uses it as a toilet. Do. Not. Use, get a taxi, more expensive but worth the money. I would rather jump in front of the next train (if it arrives) than use this service again. To whomever this may concern, go f*** yourself. Sincerely, anyone who uses this train

items.title: Absolutely disgusting level of service
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting level of service. Train strikes for three days last week. I completed half my journey this morning, then transport for wales cancelled my connecting train. I had to wait one and a half hours to travel five miles from Caldicot to Chepstow.  This train cancellation is a very frequent thing.  Why can’t the drivers or crew get up in the mornings? They should have pay docked if they don’t turn up for a shift.

items.title: Crap, what do you expect from the Welsh Government
items.review_text: This pointless review will change nothing but as other people say, useless or not on time which is what they are, then again what would you expect from a company that is owned by the Welsh Government.

items.title: The journey to no where
items.review_text:
Never mind train strikes for better pay.
Give us better services.
Am so mad with what happened today am funming beyond words. Left Liverpool at 8:00 a.m. arrive at Chester to get on the Cardiff train to get told 30 minutes later still sat on the train waiting to depart the train's been canceled. Then I get told to get on the Shrewsbury train and change at Shrewsbury. At Shrewsbury the Cardiff train the train is so full you physically can't  get on the train two coaches. I decided to wait for the next train only to have every train cancelled. It's got too 2:00 p.m. and I'm stuck in Shrewsbury so decided to go back to Liverpool I've just got back home at 4:00 pm I've spent nearly 8 hours going on a train going to no where. Liverpool ticket office gave me a full refund. 
The response that I will get from this is the weather bad  strikes there's a kitten on the track any excuse they'll give me  other than taking full responsibility of how bad the network is.

Oh by the way charging £113 open return to Cardiff is disgusting especially when the government encourages us to go green but when it's cheaper to fly than take a train there's something fundamentally wrong.

Sent  a formal  complaint  in on the phone I expected  to speak too someone regarding  this on the phone  but got sent a standard  reply.

items.title: TFW terrible service
items.review_text:
Just been unable to board my train home from Liverpool which I had a pre booked ticket for because the train was full, being only one carriage in stead of the usual two.
Apparently transport for Wales decided to send the other carriage to Wales for a rugby match. This company is appalling and shouldn’t have the contract for this so called service, nearly saw a riot on the station from dissatisfied customers

items.title: Shambles again
items.review_text: 2 carriages from holyhead to chester, crammed in like sardines, some people not able to get on the train. It's like living in 3rd world country but prices expensive. Staff on train apologetic but not their fault

items.title: Travelled from manchester to rhyl and…
items.review_text: Travelled from manchester to rhyl and return this week.  2 carriages  school holidays  standing room only.  We are both 80 plus    absolutely  ridiculous  will not use them again

items.title: Worst customer experience ever.
items.review_text:
Worst customer experience ever.

They know how to make a customer feel awful. The ticket man snatched my ticket and tore it up in my face simply because I went with my mum even though I showed him my ticket. 

They lack sympathy and standard customer service.

items.title: TFW Clearly Don’t Read Reviews and Don’t Care Either!
items.review_text:
Having just read back through a few older reviews I am shocked to see so many complaints similar to mine.
Train from Manchester Piccadilly to Swansea absolutely rammed.
 I had a suitcase and a bag and couldn’t get a seat. Others couldn’t even get on the train.
Horrendous experience.
One star for the lovely guy with the buffet trolley ( he obviously didn’t move and no one could get near him for he first hour and a half) but he was pleasant.
What is going on?
This is clearly a known problem but TFW are doing nothing about it.
I’m back in the car. Not doing that journey again.

items.title: Same as always
items.review_text: Same as always. Very few carriages for really long journeys. Passengers squashed in like Sardines. Welsh Government have no interest in rectifying the problem.

items.title: Attempting to travel from Prestatyn to…
items.review_text: Attempting to travel from Prestatyn to Chester today 26/03/22 on the 10:58 . This service is appalling . Not only are trains restricted to 1 an hour but they only have  2 carriages on them which is doubly ridiculous. When the train arrived it was totally rammed and half the people could not get one . Of the half who did , with 1 in 20 in the country having covid at the moment , today transport  for wales did more to spread covid than any other organisation anywhere with people standing squashed up tightly against each other the length of the carriages . With no guarantee of even getting on the next 2 carriage train in an hours time we cut our losses and went for a bus although that journey took 2 hours rather than 30 minutes . Transport for Wales, if they can not deliver anything like a half decent service, ought to just put their hands up and run a dedicated half hourly rail replacement service until such time as they can get rolling stock on the lines .

items.title: Stick to the Bus
items.review_text:
Never had a good experience with them. Best case scenario is the train isn't late. From thuggish attendants threatening to fine people for paying with cash (?!) to the fact that they'll be late 4 times out of 5 (if they don't just cut through your stop to meet quotas).
Now, I bought a railcard in July, and they've since changed the rules and information regarding what you get discounts for, making it useless to me now, I asked an attendant if could be refunded, as I've now spent more on the card than I'll ever get in discounts. He said yes, and apologised for the sudden change in rules, stating there had been a lot of anger anf confusion that morning, I'd just have to contact them to get a discount. After contacting them they essentially told me 'unlucky, not our problem'. Honestly never thought I'd miss Arriva, but here we are. Going to stick to the bus from this point on, just in case I get fined for standing on the train in the wrong way.

items.title: Went to catch the 17:36 from Newport to…
items.review_text: Went to catch the 17:36 from Newport to Abergavenny on the 23/09/23. Train was on-time until about 20 mins. before arrival. Then it was delayed. Arrived at 17: 42 - we boarded the train and waited...and waited for about 15 mins. Then a TRW worker came over the Public Address and said that he doesn't know what's happening but there's no driver to take the train onwards to Hereford? Eventually we had to disembark the train and wait for the 18:32 ...which turned up at 18:42 and coupled-up to the earlier train. We boarded it...and waited..and waited. It eventually left at 18:58. I was talking to a passenger who lives in Skipton and he couldn't believe how poor the service is here, the overcrowding and the poor quality of rolling stock. TRW are an absolute joke of a company - I wouldn't trust them to run a bath!! Surely there must be an investigation about how this Company can continue to operate?

items.title: Absolute Rubbish service .
items.review_text:
Absolute Rubbish service .. 2 carriages for everything packed trains no air con old stock .
Health and Safety out the window  .. How do they get away with it.. Oh yes its run by the Welsh Government isn't it .So normal safety concerns don't apply to them

items.title: Absolutely shocking again sat at…
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking again sat at Prestatyn station almost 40 Min then other week 2 carriages was full conductor almost lock me between doors prams bikes avoid just drive

items.title: Transport for wales
items.review_text:
What a shambles of a rail service  
Most of the trains are filthy
There is always problems .Delays or breakdowns .Makes you think do I get on or not.
It's amazing how many people mainly youngsters who come on without paying and they just let them go if they are having a free ride so should we.No wonder TFW are loosing money

items.title: I had a horrendous journey from Church…
items.review_text: I had a horrendous journey from Church Stretton to Hereford, a train of 2 cars, packed in like sardines, people left at stations unable to get in.  Should have been 5 cars, would still have been full.  Return journey was also crowded though not quite as much.  Also 2 cars - this was a Bank Holiday weekend! This is third world stuff

items.title: TfW. What a joke
items.review_text: I have given TFW 1 star and that is 1 star too many! What a total joke of a company. 2 carriages from Cardiff to Manchester with 3 times the number of people than seats available. Now, how much did you rip me off for tickets! The train network in the 🇬🇧 is appalling. Take a visit to Italy and see how it should run. In the meantime, I am retuning to the car. Less stressful and much cheaper. Actually half the price!

items.title: Absolutely a disgrace to the Welsh…
items.review_text: Absolutely a disgrace to the Welsh nation 2 nd class service 2 carriages with enough people onto fill 3-4 who ever is in charge instead of sitting behind a desk travel round on the trains and see the chaos !!!

items.title: Absolute joke run 2 carriages when…
items.review_text: Absolute joke run 2 carriages when rugby and Tom Jones on. Wasted money had to get taxis literally 100's of people stranded

items.title: Trains for wales run a diabolic service
items.review_text: My experience with train for wales from 13.30 manchester to port talbot was totally diabolic I have a disability and I had to stand till church Stretton reason tfw to bloody mean to make it a four carriage train instead of 2 carriage train pay over the odds to travel by train and unable to sit in comfortably on my journey I want compensation for my diabolic journey where it take me a month to recover

items.title: So full it was dangerous
items.review_text: Journey from Wrexham to Rhyl on Friday 26th May was ridiculous - just two carriages that were so jam packed full it was actually dangerous to stand on the train.

items.title: The worst transport service in the…
items.review_text: The worst transport service in the whole of the UK not had a train on time this year and the amount you charge for such a poor service is a joke

items.title: Plz read
items.review_text: Hello waited at flint train station and said on the speaker that our train was delayed which is no problem it can’t always be perfect but we had gotten on the train after it’s callings and it said it wouldn’t go to Holyhead which it had said on app and in the station it was going there. I am 16 I can not drive I have to rely on this transport I was supposed to be in Holyhead at 6:20 now I have to get off at Bangor and wait till 6:52 to get to Holyhead my 11 year old sister will be waiting nearly on hour for me all together as my mam and dad have gone for food I have a responsibility to take care of her which I can not do with these circumstances! Not happy !!!!!

items.title: Jokers! Couldn’t organise a pi** up in a brewery
items.review_text:
Only getting 1 star as there isn’t an option for 0.

Cancelling trains every day, I don’t think I’ve ever seen a train arrive on time either.

items.title: How on Earth is this a Train Company?
items.review_text: Disgusting trains, over priced tickets, last minute and constant delays without any explanation nor expected time provided, and the CONSTANT / ENDLESS announcements in English and Welsh.

items.title: Tried buying tickets online
items.review_text:
Tried buying tickets online
The times I input are not the times allocated
at the ed of the booking process.
A dreadful site to navigate.

items.title: Won't even log a complaint.
items.review_text: Train cancelled and refused a refund. They also refused to raise a complaint. It took over a month to get this answer. Not the first time either.

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking.  If I could leave 0 stars, I would.  Manchester to Cardiff - just two carriages.  Packed like sardines in a can. People standing the whole journey from Manchester to Cardiff.  Inadequate provision for luggage - most people had an overnight bag or a suitcase or a rucksack and the luggage racks were full up.  Luggage on the tables, in the aisle, under the tables and even in the one toilet for the whole train.  People packed together standing in the aisle.  One poor woman needed the loo - it took her 15 mins to clamber over luggage, and sleeping dogs and nudge past standing passengers to get to the toilet.  She then had to ask people to take their luggage out so she could get in there to use the loo.  It's an accident waiting to happen - if the driver ever needed to apply the brakes, people and luggage would go flying. I'm not a wheelchair user, but I can't see how a wheelchair could get on that train.  As a disabled person, I was lucky to get a seat and was very cramped, with my luggage on the table in front of me and someone else's luggage underneath the table.  By the time I got to Cardiff, I was in agony.  Terrible.  Like the London tube in rush hour, but for a 2.75 hour journey.

items.title: Late every day..disgraceful service
items.review_text: Late every day..disgraceful service. Think they can hide tfw and not transport for wales. Can’t complain in their own website now either.

items.title: Transport for Wales
items.review_text: Absolutely dreadful service, always late, cancellations with no explanation, expensive, poor quality trains, no seats, standing room only. The Welsh government should be ashamed of themselves.

items.title: Cancelled trains from Aberystwyth …
items.review_text:
Cancelled trains from Aberystwyth  again. And once again, an impossible delay repay website. Ludicrous service.
The coach from now on

items.title: Worst experience ever as I experienced…
items.review_text: Worst experience ever as I experienced disability discrimination from TFW staff and the customer service was awful as I boarded the train with a valid ticket, the conductor tried to charge me again. For the rest of the conductors, they are rude and unhelpful and often the trains are often delayed or cancelled.

items.title: Complete amateurs
items.review_text: The most amateurish Website of all train operators, an embarrassment to Wales. Not able to reserve seats, shambolic pricing policy, a total DISGRACE

items.title: Use other means
items.review_text: Use other means. Always cancelled at last min.

items.title: 5 star great service
items.review_text:
5 star great service 
Fed up of all the jokers moaning, if you don’t like it get the bus!!

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful - I’ve been using TFW for 3 years and they never run on time. It’s a joke - sort it out
